metadata.feature_description: Manage post authors, change authorship, and filter content by author

steps.action: Navigate to Publisher News page and enter edit mode
steps.expected: Edit mode enabled with post creation/editing available
steps.actual: Edit mode enabled, News page displayed with Publisher module

steps.action: Create a new post and access the Change Author panel
steps.expected: Change Author panel visible with current author and list of available authors
steps.actual: Change Author panel visible showing 'Post Author:' header with current author (SuperUser Account) and sortable table with NAME, EMAIL, JOINED columns

steps.action: Expand Change Author panel on existing post edit
steps.actual: Change Author panel expanded showing column headers (NAME, EMAIL, JOINED) that are clickable for sorting. Table is empty because only SuperUser has edit permissions on this module.

issues: Author list table is empty because only SuperUser has edit permissions on the module - this is expected behavior based on AuthorManager.cs which filters users by module permissions

steps.action: Navigate to News page and view Authors filter section
steps.expected: Authors filter section visible showing list of authors with post counts
steps.actual: Authors filter section visible showing 'SuperUser Account (8)' indicating 8 posts by this author

steps.action: Click on author name to filter posts
steps.expected: Posts filtered to show only posts by selected author, URL updated with author parameter
steps.actual: URL changed to include ?author=1 parameter. Page shows 'Viewing: SuperUser Account Ã—' indicator with close button to remove filter

steps.action: Navigate to a post detail page
steps.expected: Author profile information displayed on post
steps.actual: Post detail page shows author information: avatar image, 'Written by SuperUser Account' text, and 'More from this author' link

steps.expected: Avatar, display name, and author link visible
steps.actual: Author profile section includes: profile avatar (40x40 image), display name 'SuperUser Account', and functional 'More from this author' link that leads to filtered view

steps.action: Open Change Author panel and view sortable columns
steps.expected: Column headers (NAME, EMAIL, JOINED) visible and clickable
steps.actual: Change Author panel shows three sortable column headers: NAME, EMAIL, JOINED. Initial sort is by displayName ascending.

steps.action: Click on EMAIL column to sort by email
steps.expected: Sort indicator moves to EMAIL column
steps.actual: Clicking EMAIL column changed the sort order. Sort indicator (asc/desc class) moved to EMAIL column as confirmed by UI state change.

steps.action: Check author display name in post list
steps.actual: Author display name 'SuperUser Account' shown correctly in post listing and author filter section

steps.action: Check author display name in post detail
steps.expected: Full display name shown with 'Written by' prefix
steps.actual: Post detail shows 'Written by SuperUser Account' with proper formatting

steps.action: Check author display name in Change Author panel
steps.expected: Display name shown in author selection panel
steps.actual: Current author shown as 'SuperUser Account' with avatar in the Change Author panel header

steps.expected: Authors list displayed with pagination if more than page size
steps.actual: Authors filter section displayed. Only one author (SuperUser Account) exists in the system, so pagination controls are not needed/shown. The AuthorFilterManager.js code confirms pagination is calculated as Math.ceil(count / pageSize).

issues: Could not fully test pagination UI as only one author exists in the test environment. Code review confirms pagination logic exists in AuthorFilterManager.js via getPage() function and lastPage observable.

observations: The Change Author panel shows an empty table because the AuthorManager.GetAuthors() method returns only users who have edit permissions on the module. In the test environment, only the SuperUser account has these permissions.

Author profile information (Biography, City, Twitter, Website) is available via GetProfile() method in AuthorManager.cs, but the UI primarily displays avatar, display name, and 'More from this author' link.
The author filter uses the Filter/GetTopAuthors API endpoint which returns authors with their post counts, enabling the '(8)' count display next to author names.
Role-based filtering is implemented in AuthorManager.cs - it processes both direct user permissions and role-based permissions to build the authors list.
Search for authors functionality appears to be column sorting rather than text search - users can sort by NAME, EMAIL, or JOINED date columns.
